critique: The document is an amendment to the Generalized System of Preferences. The primary goal is to continue preferential treatment for eligible articles from developing countries, while also making necessary corrections and modifications. The tone is formal and legalistic, focusing on specific items and dates. The document aims to maintain stability and order in trade relations. The president likely wants to elicit a sense of stability and continued support for developing countries, while also addressing technical issues.
